title: SoC CSD 491-0-1 Pediatric Speech Sound Disorders

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Overview of class:

This course is intended to familiarize the student with normal speech sound learning, and the etiology, evaluation and treatment of articulation and phonological disorders and differences. Approaches to the collection and analysis of data will be addressed, as well as the use of that data for therapy planning.

-
Registration Requirements:

Narrow phonetic transcription skills and understanding of speech physiology.

-
Learning Objectives:

1. Understand normal speech sound acquisition.
2. Demonstrate an understanding of assessment procedures and analytic tools for performing diagnostic procedures related to developmental speech sound disorders.
3. Develop intervention plans to address developmental speech sound disorders with consideration of phonetic versus phonemic approaches, treatment efficacy, motor learning principles, as well as other various treatment approaches.

-
Teaching Method:

The course will include lectures and lab activities.

-
Evaluation Method:

Grades will be based on lab activities and three in-class exams.

-
Class Materials (Required):
Bauman-Waengler, J. (2012). Articulatory and Phonological Impairments: A Clinical Focus, (5th edition). Allyn and Bacon.

-
Class Materials (Suggested):

Bleile, K. (2006). The Late Eight. Plural Publishing.

Secord, W.A. (2007). Eliciting Sounds: Techniques and Strategies for Clinicians, 2nd edition).
